text:
Minister of State for Railways Manoj Sinha said on Wednesday that the north-eastern State capitals would be connected by rail by 2020 and Agartala would get broad gauge facility by March.

“Prime Minister Narendra Modi has accorded priority to the development of the north-eastern region, and taking the rails to hilly areas is a major challenge for us,” Mr. Sinha said. The first broad gauge trial train was rolled out here in the presence of Mr. Sinha, State PWD Minister Badal Chowdhury and Transport Minister Manik Dey. Mr. Sinha said the construction of 15-km railway track connecting Agartala with Akhaura in Bangladesh “is a top priority.” The project is funded by the Centre for connecting Tripura and West Bengal via Bangladesh.

He said the process of acquiring land in Bangladesh was complete and it would start soon in India. A 3.7-km track on Indian side would be a viaduct [through an elevated corridor] to reduce the cost of acquisition of land.

Laying of railway line from Agartala to Sabroom in South Tripura district, bordering Bangladesh, would be completed by 2018, he said. — PTI
title: Northeast capitals to get rail link by 2020
